page.title: 07Stoke Albany - Amenities
page.content: The only shop in Stoke Albany is the post office. It is a general grocery store. Mrs. Bellamy has lived there all her life and is to receive the Member of the British Empire medal this year for service to the village. The post office has been in her family for hundreds of years. The post office was expanded 38 years ago. It has posters in the window to tell people things that are happening such as Stoke Feast, an annual fete which takes place on the village green. In 1966 the village school closed down. It is now the village hall. The Brownies meet there at 6.30pm on Tuesdays. Children of primary school age go to school in Wilbarston and older children go to school in Rothwell or Kettering. On a Thursday the old people are taken by car to Marlow House Day Care Centre in Desborough.
